actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore a capital gains tax differential for individuals and corporations on small business stock held more than 4 years.

summary.text: Venture Capital Incentive Act of 1991 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit both corporate and noncorporate taxpayers an income tax deduction of 40 percent of the net capital gain from an investment in the stock a qualified small business which devotes at least 18 percent of its total annual expenditures to research and development. Allows the taxpayer is the initial acquirer of the particular stock and holds the stock for at least four years. Adds the amount of the deduction for capital gain from such investments as a tax preference item for purposes of determining alternative minimum tax liability.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore a capital gains tax differential for individuals and corporations on small business stock held more than 4 years.
